image.altText: Black gloves hold a pink vape in its packaging.

props.synopsis: Two Canberra men face the ACT Magistrates Court after they were arrested in a police sting targeting the trade in illegal vapes.

title.children: Two men facing charges after allegedly being caught with thousands of vapes and cash in Canberra

image.altText: ACT Supreme Court, Magistrates Court, building, generic

props.synopsis: The boy received a suspended sentence and good behaviour bond after a judge found he had demonstrated a degree of remorse.

title.children: Canberra school boy who raped 14-year-old girl avoids jail

image.altText: A woman with long black hair stands in front of a microphone looking serious.

props.synopsis: Former leader Jeremy Hanson is challenging Ms Lee for the top spot.

title.children: 'I'm the best person': Elizabeth Lee to recontest Canberra Liberals leadership

image.altText: An illustration shows one woman with her hand to her forehead, on the phone, and another with her head in her hands

props.synopsis: Decriminalisation was meant to give women access to safe, affordable abortions as a form of health care. Five years on, the ABC can reveal glaring examples of the system failing people in rural and regional areas at almost every step.

title.children: Melissa was turned away from hospital on the day of her abortion in Queanbeyan. Doctors say it's a symptom of an 'unspoken ban'

image.altText: People queue while wearing masks

props.synopsis: Australia's COVID-19 response frayed after early successes, damaging the public's trust and making it unlikely that lockdowns or other harsh restrictions will be tolerated again, a federal government review has found.

title.children: Federal government to establish Centre for Disease Control in Canberra after COVID response review

image.altText: CCTV footage shows 'targeted' vandalism and theft at Canberra Hindu temple

props.synopsis: This is not the first time the buildings have been targeted by thieves and some community members say they are "horrified".

title.children: Two Hindu temples burgled, vandalised in broad daylight in Canberra

image.altText: An older man in a red shirt standing in front of a tree

props.synopsis: When spraying crops, John O'Brien would end up covered in chemicals including paraquat. He's one of six farmers from Crookwell who say they have been diagnosed with Parkinson's Disease.

title.children: Six farmers who grew up in the same town near Goulburn getting 'covered' in chemicals now all have Parkinson's

props.synopsis: Last year the ACT became the first Australian jurisdiction to decriminalise small amounts of illicit drugs. One year on, what has happened in the territory?

title.children: Small amounts of drugs were decriminalised in the ACT, but it didn't turn Canberra into our 'party capital'

image.altText: A man standing in a workshop holds a wooden box closed.

props.synopsis: After years of collecting beautiful pieces of timber, Australian woodworker Scott Mitchell couldn't believe it when he was asked to craft part of a gift for King Charles III.

title.children: Meet the Australian woodworker who crafted a box fit for a king

image.altText: Donald Trump, dressed in a suit and red tie, leans into a microphone looking out a crowd.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is under fire over comments a comedian made about Puerto Rico at a New York rally. But so far he has not acknowledged the anger and hurt that members of the community feel despite courting their votes in a must-win state.

title.children: It's a common adage that America has made its mind up on Trump. But has his campaign finally gone too far?

image.altText: RBA governor Michele Bullock at press conference on June 18, 2024

props.synopsis: Playing bad Santa this Christmas may not please your friends and family, but it could just save them some money if they have a mortgage.

title.children: When will we get an interest rate cut? It's largely up to you

image.altText: A woman in a white coveralls stands next two two people on the footpath near an area cordoned off by crime scene tape

props.synopsis: South Australian police are investigating whether the death of a 26-year-old woman with "significant physical and intellectual disabilities" was the result of criminal neglect.

title.children: Death of 26yo woman who lived with 'significant' disabilities in 'squalid' conditions declared a major crime

image.altText: A building with a turbine attached to it.

props.synopsis: Electricity network operator Transgrid has defended its management of failed generators which left around 20,000 people in the NSW far west without reliable power.

title.children: Transgrid denies maintenance was neglected on Broken Hill generators as investigation launched

image.altText: The silhouette of two young people looking out onto a beach at sunset

props.synopsis: More than one in four young people are experiencing serious threats of violence by a sibling, according to new research obtained by triple j hack.

title.children: Sibling-to-sibling violence is thought to be very common. Why don't we know more about it?

image.altText: Mark Butler

props.synopsis: Mark Butler says the leaders who oversaw Australia's COVID-19 pandemic response don't need to say sorry to rebuild public trust.

title.children: Health minister says leaders don't need to say sorry for COVID response

image.altText: Alan Joyce touches Anthony Albanese as they sit together at an unveiling in a Qantas facility. Adam Goodes is also pictured

props.synopsis: It is possible to understand and empathise with the PM's indignation over the Qantas flights controversy while simultaneously disagreeing with his diagnosis that it's a non-story.

title.children: The registers of interest reveal two types of politicians. One of them explains Albanese's rage over Qantas

image.altText: Several men in military fatigues ride on the back of a vehicle with the number plate 'Indonesia'

props.synopsis: China has historically been seen as the greatest threat to national security by Indonesia's military, including new President Prabowo Subianto. That is changing.

title.children: Make EVs not war: Why Indonesia driving off Chinese vessels in the South China Sea is unlikely to escalate

image.altText: Portrait photo of David DePape. He has shoulder length hair, stubble, and brown eyes.

props.synopsis: Paul Pelosi was severely injured when he was attacked with a hammer in his San Francisco home in 2022. David DePape was sentenced to life in prison on state charges after also being sentenced to 30 years in a federal court.

title.children: Man who attacked Nancy Pelosi's husband gets life term

image.altText: upright rat

props.synopsis: Scientists say their research shows the rats have a similar sense of smell to dogs, but they're able to fit in tighter spaces.

title.children: Meet Kirsty, Betty and Desmond — the giant rats fighting the illegal animal trade

image.altText: Dr Mahyar Amjadi sits at a desk in an office.

props.synopsis: A Sydney plastic surgeon who patients say left them with "disfigurement" has been found guilty of professional misconduct. One of his former patients says her life was ruined after going under the knife.

title.children: Plastic surgeon found guilty of professional misconduct after tummy tucks, muscle implants and breast lifts go wrong

image.altText: four people stand holding a paper which says annual report

props.synopsis: The Vatican's child protection commission's first annual report found the church must do a better job of handling compensation for the victims of clergy sexual abuse. The commission said compensation went beyond money and included "a much broader spectrum of actions."

title.children: Vatican commission says Catholic Church must do better job on compensating abuse victims

image.altText: Grace Nweke of New Zealand and Courtney Bruce of Australia compete for the ball above their head

props.synopsis: A relentless defensive performance by Courtney Bruce and Sunday Aryang has been the foundation for the Diamonds' pride-restoring 13-goal victory over New Zealand.

title.children: Relentless defence inspires Diamonds to commanding win over Silver Ferns

image.altText: A man with a half smile and wire-free rimmed glasses poses for a photo.

props.synopsis: Zhang Yiming, 41, topped the Hurun China Rich List with a personal wealth of around $75 billion, but China has lost a third of its billionaires since its peak in 2021.

title.children: China's new richest man is wealthier than 90 countries

image.altText: A picture of two jack o lantern pumpkins on a porch

props.synopsis: More than one in five Australians are set to celebrate Halloween this year. Here's why its popularity has exploded.

title.children: Why Australians are celebrating Halloween more than ever

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair next to a woman standing outside a courthouse

props.synopsis: Rob Pyne says he is facing the possibility of having to resign as a Cairns councillor after being ordered to pay damages for defaming a local government executive whom he likened to a Star Wars villain.

title.children: Former Queensland MP and former activist ordered to pay six-figure sums for defamation

image.altText: Street sign on a crossroad showing signs of Angledool road, Ridge road, walgett

props.synopsis: A senior constable has been released on bail after he allegedly travelled 780 kilometres to steal $100,000 in cash from a 78-year- old man in a small NSW town.

title.children: Police officer allegedly tied up 78yo man before stealing $100k cash, court hears

image.altText: A woman stands with three kids on a bike in tremote community of Mylga Bore

props.synopsis: In the remote Australian outback, where ancient Aboriginal songlines traverse the unforgiving landscape, missionaries from the United States are preaching a religious movement.

title.children: In the remote community of Mulga Bore, every resident is a Mormon

image.altText: Woman with bandage on wound where she lost arm

props.synopsis: A North Queensland woman whose own dog bit off her forearm is devastated that police had to shoot her pet dead.

title.children: Woman whose dog bit off her forearm says she wishes she'd been able to save her pet

image.altText: Jake Anastas with Tori Anastas

props.synopsis: The family of 29-year-old pilot Jake Anastas have described him as someone who "made everything brighter".

title.children: Wife pays tribute to 'my best friend in the world' after husband killed in midair collision

image.altText: A Tasmania Police officer stands in front of a patrol car in Hobart's CBD.

props.synopsis: A senior female Tasmania Police officer has been sacked following an investigation into allegations she harassed female colleagues at a work Christmas party last year.

title.children: Female Tasmania Police inspector sacked following sexual misconduct investigation

image.altText: Two men, one bald and one mulleted, wearing green Australian jerseys have their arms outstretched towards each-other

props.synopsis: Members of Australia's wheelchair rugby league team, the Wheelaroos, say it's the "most inclusive sport", and they hope a first-ever clash with New Zealand will help grow the sport in the region.

title.children: The Wheelaroos play a uniquely inclusive sport. Now they embark on the newest trans-Tasman rivalry

image.altText: Several plastic bags filled with gold coins outside a storage locker.

props.synopsis: Police allege a women charged with the theft of 63,000 limited edition Bluey coins earlier this year was the getaway driver. The 27-year-old Western Sydney woman is the third person to be arrested for the theft as 40,000 of the missing coins were discovered.

title.children: Police find more than 40,000 stolen Bluey coins in storage facility months after robbery

image.altText: Death cap mushrooms.

props.synopsis: An elderly woman died in Melbourne's east after consuming a meal that contained poisonous mushrooms foraged from her own garden. Coronial findings into her death were released on Wednesday.

title.children: Coroner issues warning after elderly Victorian woman dies from eating wild mushrooms

image.altText: Yankees fans wrestle with Mookie Betts

props.synopsis: Two Yankees fans try to rip the ball from the glove of LA Dodgers star Mookie Betts after he makes a catch in game four of the World Series at Yankee Stadium.

title.children: Yankees fans booted from the stadium after ripping ball from star's glove in bizarre World Series scenes

image.altText: Houses along coast with water

props.synopsis: According to a handful of new research, the number of low-pressure systems around Australia is decreasing, bringing predictions of a future, dryer climate.

title.children: Australia's rainfall shifting as low-pressure systems become less frequent
